item.title: Deep Transfer Learning for Classification of Breast Cancer
item.description: Deep Transfer Learning for Classification of Breast Cancer By Jordan Kevin Buwa Mbouobda Supervision: Dr. Prudence Djagba Introduction Deep transfer learning is a machine learning technique that leverages knowledge from one task to improve the performance on a different but related task. In the context of breast cancer classification, algorithms are used to distinguish between cancerous and non-cancerous tumors in medical images such as mammograms. According to a study conducted by Hyuna Sung, Jacques Ferlay, and other scholars in 2020, there were 19.

item.title: Machine Learning algorithms
item.description: Real-world examples of various types of Markov Chain models in Machine Learning By Jordan Kevin Buwa Mbouobda Supervision: Dr. Chris Wood Introduction Markov Chains are powerful models that can capture sequential dependencies in data. They have a wide range of applications in various fields, including Machine Learning. In this presentation, we will explore some real-world examples of Markov Chain models in Machine Learning. Markov Decision Process To understand the Markov decision process, let’s consider you’re playing with a die.
